Documentation is available at Example.php

  1. <?php
  2. /**
  3.  * PHPSpec
  4.  *
  5.  * LICENSE
  6.  *
  7.  * This file is subject to the GNU Lesser General Public License Version 3
  8.  * that is bundled with this package in the file LICENSE.
  9.  * It is also available through the world-wide-web at this URL:
  10.  * http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl-3.0.txt
  11.  * If you did not receive a copy of the license and are unable to
  12.  * obtain it through the world-wide-web, please send an email
  13.  * to license@phpspec.org so we can send you a copy immediately.
  14.  *
  15.  * @category   PHPSpec
  16.  * @package    PHPSpec
  17.  * @copyright  Copyright (c) 2007 Pádraic Brady, Travis Swicegood
  18.  * @license    http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl-3.0.txt GNU Lesser General Public Licence Version 3
  19.  */
  20.  
  21. /**
  22.  * @category   PHPSpec
  23.  * @package    PHPSpec
  24.  * @copyright  Copyright (c) 2007 Pádraic Brady, Travis Swicegood
  25.  * @license    http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl-3.0.txt GNU Lesser General Public Licence Version 3
  26.  */
  27. class PHPSpec_Runner_Example
  28. {
  29.  
  30.     protected $_context = null;
  31.     protected $_methodName = null;
  32.     protected $_specificationText = null;
  33.     protected $_failedMessage = null;
  34.  
  35.     public function __construct(PHPSpec_Context $context, $methodName)
  36.     {
  37.         $this->_context = $context;
  38.         $this->_methodName = $methodName;
  39.         $this->_specificationText = $this->_setSpecificationText($this->_methodName);
  40.     }
  41.  
  42.     public function getMethodName()
  43.     {
  44.         return $this->_methodName;
  45.     }
  46.  
  47.     public function getSpecificationText()
  48.     {
  49.         return $this->_specificationText;
  50.     }
  51.  
  52.     public function getContextDescription()
  53.     {
  54.         return $this->_context->getDescription();
  55.     }
  56.  
  57.     public function getSpecificationBeingExecuted()
  58.     {
  59.         if (is_null($this->_specificationBeingExecuted)) {
  60.             throw new PHPSpec_Exception('cannot return a PHPSpec_Specification until the example is executed');
  61.         }
  62.         return $this->_specificationBeingExecuted;
  63.     }
  64.  
  65.     public function getFailedMessage()
  66.     {
  67.         if (is_null($this->_failedMessage)) {
  68.             throw new PHPSpec_Exception('cannot return a failure message until the example is executed');
  69.         }
  70.         return $this->_failedMessage;
  71.     }
  72.  
  73.     public function execute()
  74.     {
  75.         $this->_context->clearCurrentSpecification();
  76.  
  77.         /**
  78.          * spec execution
  79.          */
  80.         if (method_exists($this->_context, 'before')) {
  81.             $this->_context->before();
  82.         }
  83.  
  84.         try {
  85.             $this->_context->{$this->_methodName}();
  86.         } catch (PHPSpec_Runner_FailedMatcherException $e) {
  87.         }
  88.  
  89.         if (method_exists($this->_context, 'after')) {
  90.             $this->_context->after();
  91.         }
  92.  
  93.         /**
  94.          * Result collection
  95.          */
  96.         $this->_specificationBeingExecuted = $this->_context->getCurrentSpecification();
  97.         if (is_null($this->_specificationBeingExecuted)) {
  98.             return;
  99.         }
  100.  
  101.         $expected = $this->_specificationBeingExecuted->getExpectation()->getExpectedMatcherResult();
  102.         $actual = $this->_specificationBeingExecuted->getMatcherResult();
  103.         if ($expected !== $actual) { // ===
  104.             if ($expected === true) {
  105.                 $this->_failedMessage = $this->_specificationBeingExecuted->getMatcherFailureMessage();
  106.             } else {
  107.                 $this->_failedMessage = $this->_specificationBeingExecuted->getMatcherNegativeFailureMessage();
  108.             }
  109.             throw new PHPSpec_Runner_FailedMatcherException(); // add spec data later
  110.         }
  111.     }
  112.  
  113.     protected function _setSpecificationText($methodName)
  114.     {
  115.         $methodName = substr($methodName, 2);
  116.         $terms = preg_split("/(?=[[:upper:]])/", $methodName, -1, PREG_SPLIT_NO_EMPTY);
  117.         $termsLowercase = array_map('strtolower', $terms);
  118.         return implode(' ', $termsLowercase);
  119.     }
  120. }

Documentation generated on Wed, 09 Jan 2008 16:01:56 +0000 by phpDocumentor 1.4.1
